onset.Description: Onset of the event measured from the beginning of the acquisition of the first volume in the corresponding task imaging data file.

duration.Description: Duration of the event (measured from onset) in seconds.

stim_file.Description: Represents the location of the stimulus file presented at the given onset time. The values under the stim_file column correspond to a path relative to '/stimuli'.

trial_type.Description: Primary categorization of each trial to identify them as instances of the experimental conditions.

Levels.fix: Fixation trial. No stimuli presented, just a blank gray screen.
Levels.faces: Faces trial. Stimuli were videos of human faces.
Levels.bodies: Bodies trial. Stimuli were videos of human bodies.
Levels.scenes: Scenes trial. Stimuli were videos of scenes.
Levels.objects: Objects trial. Stimuli were videos of objects.
Levels.scrambled: Scrambled trial. Stimuli were scrambled versions of other videos in the stimuli set such that no meaningful concepts appeared in the scrambled video.

block.Description: Signifies the current block in the experiment. The duration of a block is 18 seconds. There are 25 blocks in one run. Blocks are separated by their trial_type.

hit.Description: Value of participant's button press on one-back trials (the second of two consecutive repitions of the same video). All trials that are not one-back trials are denoted with 'n/a' as button press was only registered on one-back trials.
